title: Defining Axis of Symmetry
text: The axis of symmetry is the line that separates the parabola into two symmetric halves.

title: Vertical Parabola Axis
text: For parabolas that open vertically, the axis of symmetry is a vertical line defined by an x-value.

title: Relation to Vertex
text: The axis of symmetry intersects the parabola at the vertex, so the equation of the line of the axis can be found through the x-value of the vertex.

title: Calculating Value
text: The x-value of the coordinate can be calculated with $$\frac{-b}{2} a$$ when the quadratic is in the form $${ax}^2+bx+c$$

title: Plugging in Values
text: What is the result when $$a=2$$, $$b=-10$$, and $$c=4$$ is plugged into the formula $$\frac{-b}{2} a$$?
